You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You task is to evaluate MEMORY based on the criterion.
Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.

[Criterion]
Helpfulness (1-5): How much the MEMORY provides helpful information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT. An helpful memory should contain sentences that are naturally connected, representing the development (e.g., causality) of two speakers' past interactions.

For your information:
A score of 1 means that most sentences in MEMORY do not benefit generating a next response or are structured in an unnatural way that does not tell us the connection, relevancy, or causality of events.
A score of 5 means that MEMORY contains some sentences providing information relevant to DIALOGUE CONTEXT. And, sentences in it should be naturally connected so the causality/relevancy is clearly demonstrated.

[Evaluation Steps]
1. Read DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY carefully. 
2. Rate MEMORY on a scale of 1-5 according to the criterion above. 
3. Provide a brief explanation for your rating.
4. Always generate your helpfulness score after the phrase `Helpfulness Score:`

I am not a fan of the outdoors. Did your friends manage to have a good time anyway? Speaker A: Oh they did. We had some nice snacks along the way. Oddly enough, we had some trail mix that someone had made at home. It was quite tasty. We also had some juice and water packed to make sure everyone stayed hydrated. You should join us one day! I'll make it as fun as possible. Speaker B: I will someday. just not in the summer when all the bugs are out! Where do you go hiking the most? Speaker A: I like to go hiking in the local trails here. I am familiar with them and there's so many routes that I can take. Sadly, the bugs are as bad here as they are anywhere else..... Speaker B: They can't be that bad in the fall right? I hope? Do you camp most every weekend? Speaker A: A least a couple of times a month. Sometimes, yeah, I go every weekend to relax. Being in nature is so relaxing to me. And nah the bugs aren't too bad in the fall and winter. There's a beautiful river along one trail that I bet you'd love to see.  Speaker B: That sounds like it would be relaxing. I would probable be okay if we didn't run into any wolves, bears etc. Have you ever came across any predators when you were camping?

MEMORY:
1. Speaker A enjoys camping trips and looking for wild animals in the woods.
2. Speaker B recently went on a long hike and enjoyed it
3. Speaker A has planned several camping trips for the summer and will be doing a part of the Appalachian Trail.
4. Speaker A is comfortable around animals in the woods but admits a bear would make them jumpy.
5. Speaker B dislikes bugs and is not a fan of camping, hiking, or the outdoors.
6. Speaker A enjoys hiking, birdwatching, and spotting rare animals.
